ATTACHMENT ID: 12909849 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~ekoifman] Looks like there are 2 versioning methods now. I am seeing another side file (_orc_acid_version) with version info. Why not use that? Reading version from side file is cheaper (read a single int from side file instead of parsing/reading from footer) isn't it?

_orc_acid_version is not written consistently. in fact is't only there from streaming ingest use case.
Also, it's written into the partition dir, which can have base/deltas written by different versions of hive.
I agree it's cheaper but putting into the file itself is more reliable especially since people tend to try to move acid files around.

I agree that it's safer and consistent to have version info on the file itself. But if the side file and version in the footer exists then we should have a precedence for source of truth and probably raise an exception if the version differs. +1 for the current patch, pending tests. Can you please create a follow up for fixing the side file version update + fixes?
